    Export Nested Data Frames to Files Based on Grouping Columns

    nest_export.Rd

    The nest_export function exports nested data frames or data tables stored within a column of a data table (nest_dt) to files. It expands the nested data, groups it by specified columns (group_cols), and writes the data to files within directories reflecting the groupings. The files can be saved as tab-separated (.txt) or comma-separated (.csv) values.

    nest_export(
  nest_dt,
  group_cols = NULL,
  nest_col = NULL,
  export_path = tempdir(),
  file_type = "txt"
)

    Arguments

    nest_dt

    A data.frame or data.table containing at least one nested column of data frames or data tables. This is the input data from which nested data will be exported.

    group_cols

    A non-empty character vector specifying the columns in nest_dt to use for grouping when exporting. Directories will be created based on combinations of these groupings.

    nest_col

    A single character string specifying the name of the column in nest_dt that contains the nested data frames or data tables to be exported. This name also serves as the base filename for the exported files.

    export_path

    A single character string specifying the base directory path where the files will be exported. If the directory does not exist, it will be created. Defaults to tempdir().

    file_type

    A character string specifying the type of file to export: either "txt" for tab-separated values or "csv" for comma-separated values. Defaults to "txt". Case-insensitive.

    Value

    An integer representing the total number of files exported successfully.

    Details

    The function performs the following steps:

    1. Validates the input parameters, ensuring that nest_col and group_cols are provided and exist within nest_dt. It checks that file_type is either "txt" or "csv".

    2. Identifies the nested column specified by nest_col and expands it by unnesting the data frames or data tables it contains.

    3. Groups the expanded data by the columns specified in group_cols.

    4. For each group, constructs a directory path based on the grouping values under export_path and writes the data to a file named after nest_col, using the specified file_type.

    5. Utilizes multiple threads when writing files for efficiency, using data.table::fwrite.

    Note

    • The nest_dt must contain at least one nested column of data frames or data tables.

    • The group_cols must be a non-empty character vector corresponding to columns in nest_dt.

    • The nest_col must be a single character string corresponding to a column name in nest_dt.

    • If export_path does not exist, the function will create it.

    • The function leverages multi-threading via data.table::fwrite for faster file writing.

    • The original nest_dt is not modified; a modified copy is used internally.

    • If an error occurs during the export process, the function stops and returns an error message.

    Examples

    # Data Nesting Operation
dt_nest <- w2l_nest(data = iris, cols2l = 1:2, by = "Species")
# Export Nested Data
nest_export(nest_dt = dt_nest, nest_col = "data",
            group_cols = c("name", "Species"))
#> [1] 6
# Check Export Results
list.files(path = tempdir(), pattern = "txt", recursive = TRUE)
#> [1] "Sepal.Length/setosa/data.txt"     "Sepal.Length/versicolor/data.txt"
#> [3] "Sepal.Length/virginica/data.txt"  "Sepal.Width/setosa/data.txt"     
#> [5] "Sepal.Width/versicolor/data.txt"  "Sepal.Width/virginica/data.txt"
